required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Individual Responder Analysis of the Effectiveness of Manual Therapy and Exercise Versus Usual Care in Patients With Chronic Nonspecific Neck Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Modelo Preditivo Para os Resultados de Sucesso Com um Programa Combinado de Terapia Manual e exercício em indivíduos Com Dor Cervical crónica de Origem não-especifica

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the effectiveness of a combined intervention of manual therapy and exercise versus usual care, on pain intensity, disability, and global perceived recovery, in patients with chronic nonspecific neck pain.

primary_outcome.description: Measured using a Numeric Pain Rating Scale (range: 0 - 10 points)
Measured using a Numeric Pain Rating Scale (range: 0 - 10 points)
Measured using a Numeric Pain Rating Scale (range: 0 - 10 points)
Measured using a Numeric Pain Rating Scale (range: 0 - 10 points)
Measured using the Neck Disability Index (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability)
Measured using the Neck Disability Index (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability)
Measured using the Neck Disability Index (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability)
Measured using the Neck Disability Index (range: 0-50 and higher scores are indicative of more disability)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline of the global perceived recovery at 3 weeks; 6 weeks; Follow-up 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using Patient Global Impression of Change Scale to quantify a patient's global improvement over time.

intervention.description: Experimental group: Manual Therapy and Exercise Participants in this group will receive a 6-weeks program of mobilization and progressive exercise programme for the neck flexors, 2 times a week.
Active Comparator: Usual Care Participants in this group will receive usual care in physiotherapy during the 6-weeks period.

overall_official.affiliation: Nova Medical School | Faculdade de Ciências Médicas - Universidade Nova de Lisboa
